revised_title: Case Study: William Payne's Kidney and Bladder Conditions
tldr: The article presents a case study of William Payne, a 71-year-old patient suffering from kidney and bladder issues, including bladder stones and scrotal rupture. Despite various treatments, Payne passed away, and upon autopsy, it was discovered that a large stone in the neck of the bladder was the likely cause of death.
